    • Uses of ProcessException in org.jpac

      Subclasses of ProcessException in org.jpac 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AsynchronousTaskException
      might be thrown by the .finished.await() method of an AsynchronousTask.
      class  EmergencyStopException
      thrown, if an emergency stop condition arises.
      class  EventTimedoutException
      thrown, if an awaited event, did not occur in time
      class  InconsistencyException
      thrown, if an internal error has been encountered by the runtime environment of jPac
      class  IndexOutOfRangeException
      thrown, if an index is out of range, while accessing data of a process image
      class  InEveryCycleDoException
      thrown to the work() method of a module, if an exception condition has been encountered while processing inEveryCycleDo().
      class  InputInterlockException
      thrown at a module (inside work()), if the application code implemented inside AbstractModule.preCheckInterlocks() encounters an error condition
      class  InterlockException
      base class for interlock exceptions
      class  MonitorException
      thrown at a module (inside work()), if an event (Fireable) has been fired, which is monitored by it
      class  NumberOutOfRangeException
      thrown, if a value to be assigned to decimal or signed integer exceeds the signals range of values
      class  OutputInterlockException
      thrown at a module (inside work()), if the application code implemented inside AbstractModule.postCheckInterlocks() encounters an error condition
      class  ShutdownRequestException
      is thrown at every module (inside work()), if some instance (another module calling shutdown() or the OS) requests a shutdown of the elbfisch application.
      class  SignalAccessException
      thrown, if a module tries to set() a signal, which does not belong to it (the module is not the containing module of the signal), or the signal is connected by another signal as a target signal.
      class  SignalAlreadyConnectedException
      thrown, if a attempt is made to connect a signal as a target more than once
      class  SignalAlreadyExistsException
      thrown, if a signal with the same name already exists
      class  SignalInvalidException
      thrown, if an attempt is made to read a signal which is invalid
      class  SignalNotRegisteredException
      thrown, if an attempt is made to fetch a signal, which is not present (registered) yet
      class  SomeEventsNotProcessedException
      thrown by jPac, if not all modules could have been processed in time
      class  WrongUseException

      ProcessEvent ProcessEvent.await()
      used to await the process event.
      ProcessEvent ProcessEvent.await(long nanoseconds)
      used to await the process event.
      abstract void AsynchronousTask.doIt()
      must implemented to fulfill the application specific function of this AsynchronousTask.
      boolean Fireable.evaluateFiredCondition()
      checks, if the event has been fired
      boolean ProcessEvent.evaluateFiredCondition()
      used to check, if an process event is currently fired
      boolean CharStringChanges.fire() 
      boolean ConjunctiveEvent.fire() 
      boolean DecimalChanges.fire() 
      boolean DecimalExceeds.fire() 
      boolean DecimalFallsBelow.fire() 
      boolean DisjunctiveEvent.fire() 
      boolean EmergencyStopAcknowledged.fire() 
      boolean ExclusiveDisjunctiveEvent.fire() 
      abstract boolean Fireable.fire()
      is called by jPac in every cycle to check, if the fire condition occured the fire condition must be true for at least one call. on occurrence it is latched by the Fireable, until it is processed.
      boolean ImpossibleEvent.fire() 
      boolean LogicalBecomes.fire() 
      boolean LogicalToggles.fire() 
      boolean NextCycle.fire() 
      boolean NthCycle.fire() 
      boolean PeriodOfTime.fire() 
      boolean SignedIntegerChanges.fire() 
      boolean SignedIntegerExceeds.fire() 
      boolean SignedIntegerFallsBelow.fire() 
      boolean TimerExpires.fire() 
      protected abstract void AbstractModule.inEveryCycleDo()
      is invoked by jPac in every cycle to let it handle application specific code, which must be run continously. the application code inside inEveryCycleDo() is stateless.
      void AbstractModule.shutdown(int exitCode)
      used to shutdown the the elbfisch application.
      protected abstract void AbstractModule.work()
      central working method of the module.
